intro: Zehneria leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited zehneria, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that turns white when mature, giving the plant its common name. Zehneria leucocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
